author: Staff Reporter
text:
Police personnel to be trained in the sports to mange stress

Priemme Dominique of class III of The Study School came out with flying colours in the first-ever inter-school Archery championship held at the Police Training School ground in Gorimedu on Saturday. He participated in the Indian bow category and bagged the gold medal in the boys’ under-10 section.

Dhavin of class V of The Study School bagged the gold medal in the mini sub-junior category while Riwana Begum and P. Jagan of Alpha Matriculation Higher Secondary School won the gold medal in the mini sub-junior girls and boys categories respectively.

Organised by the Puducherry Archery Sports Association, the tournament had as many as 40 participants from various schools in Puducherry.

Kuldeep Kumar, chief coach for Puducherry and the general secretary of PASA said that policemen in the city will be trained in archery. It will be handy for policemen and help them manage stress and achieve their targets.
title: First inter-school archery meet held
